components.description: A stick-figure icon of a woman, generally used to indicate a female restroom. The male equivalent is the Mens Symbol emoji.
components.title: Womens Symbol

description: A stick-figure icon of a woman, generally used to indicate a female restroom. The male equivalent is the Mens Symbol emoji.
title: Womens Symbol

version.description:
Released in October 2010, Unicode 6.0 was the first version of the Unicode Standard to support emoji.

Some characters in prior versions of Unicode were retroactively updated to provide an emoji presentation. This release was the first to introduce new characters for the sole purpose of compatability with emojis being used in Japan.

emoji_net_data.category: Transport And Map Symbols -> Signage and other symbols

bn:00102884a: Of, relating to, or denoting the sex which is generally characterized as the one associated with the larger gametes (for species which have two sexes and for which this distinction can be made).
Being the sex (of plant or animal) that produces fertilizable gametes (ova) from which offspring develop
Belonging to the sex with larger, fertilizable gametes.

Belonging to the sex which typically produces eggs, which in humans and most other mammals is typically the one which has XX chromosomes; belonging to the sex which has larger gametes (for species which have two sexes and for which this distinction can be made).

bn:00102886a: Having the qualities associated with women.
Associated with women and not with men
Having the qualities stereotypically associated with women: nurturing, not aggressive.

bn:00094275v: To be placed in an upright or vertical orientation.

bn:00090583v: To allow urine to flow from the bladder out of the body.
To pass urine from the body.

bn:13669747v: To use the toilet, or assist (a child etc) in using the toilet

bn:00001530n: A woman is a female human.
An animal of the sex that produces eggs.
An adult human member of the sex that produces ova and bears young.
An adult female person (as opposed to a man)

bn:00009020n: A room or building equipped with one or more toilets
A room or building equipped with one or more toilets.
The room where human sanitation takes place, a toilet, lavatory or washroom
A toilet, especially a public one.
A toilet room is a room containing a toilet and sometimes a sink.
A public room containing a toilet.
The one that contains a toilet and sometimes a sink
A flush toilet, or the room, in a public place, containing one
A bathroom; a washroom; a room containing a toilet.

bn:00015106n: A plumbing fixture for defecation and urination
A toilet is a sanitation fixture used primarily for the disposal of human urine and feces.
A sanitation fixture used primarily for the disposal of human excrement and urine
A ceramic device used for depositing and removing human excrement with water through flushing.
A chamber pot is a bowl-shaped container with a handle, and often a lid, kept in the bedroom under a bed or in the cabinet of a nightstand and generally used as a toilet at night.

bn:00037634n: Either of two main divisions (either male or female) into which many organisms can be placed, according to reproductive function or organs.
Biological sex: the sum of the biological characteristics by which male and female and other organisms are distinguished.
Gender is the range of physical, biological, mental and behavioral characteristics pertaining to, and differentiating between, masculinity and femininity.
The distinction between male and female or masculinity and femininity
Organisms of many species are specialized into male and female varieties, each known as a sex.
Range of physical, mental, and behavioral characteristics distinguishing between masculinity and femininity
The properties that distinguish organisms on the basis of their reproductive roles
Gender is the range of characteristics pertaining to, and differentiating between, masculinity and femininity.
A main division into which an organism is placed according to its reproductive functions or organs.
Biological sex of persons or animals.
A content descriptor developed by the Pan European Gaming Information (PEGI) and the British Board of Film Classification (BBFC).

bn:00034453n: A young female human; (in contrast to boy), a female child or young adult.
A title of respect for a young woman (usually unmarried) with or without a name used.
A young female person, usually a child or teenager.
A girl is any female human from birth through childhood and adolescence to attainment of adulthood when she becomes a woman.
A girl is a female human from birth through childhood and adolescence to attainment of adulthood when she becomes a woman.

bn:00020920n: A public toilet is a room or small building containing one or more toilets and possibly also urinals which is available for use by the general public, or in a broader meaning of "public", by customers of other services.
A room or building equipped with one or more toilets.
A toilet that is available to the public

bn:00049666n: A polite name for any woman

apple_vendor_description: The women's room emoji on Apple devices presents a stylized, inviting icon with a classic rounded silhouette for the female figure, subtly shaded with Apple's characteristic glossy 3D effect and soft gradients.  A delicate, almost pearl-like sheen adds to its clean and accessible design, symbolizing a safe and designated space for women.  It's commonly used in digital communication to indicate restrooms or facilities specifically for women.
